channel.title: Full Stack Data Engineer
channel.description: Recent content on Full Stack Data Engineer

item.title: Databricks vs Snowflake
item.description:
TL;DR

Databricks for AI, Snowflake for BI; Databricks for Engineering*, Snowflake for Analyst; Databricks for In-house Development, Snowflake for Consulting Engagements.

*Sorry True Data Scientist, you are referred as a ML Engineer here.

A slightly longer version: Between those two, If you are looking for a Modern Data Warehousing solution mainly serving Data Analyst or Business Analyst, pick Snowflake; If you are looking for a modern Data Lake mainly serving Data Scientists and Engineers , pick Databricks. If you are looking for something serving all of them, either would work - But what is your team’s bread and butter?

item.title: Kevin Tian
item.description:
Seasoned engineering leader with a proven track record of driving data and AI innovation. Skilled in leading high-performing teams, architecting cloud-native solutions, and delivering complex projects. Hands on experience in Azure, AWS, GCP and multi-cloud data solution.

I have experience in leading different data and AI teams, which includes:

  • Building multiple engineering teams from the ground up
  • Scaling engineering teams from small, tight-knit groups to larger, more distributed teams of 10 or more members
  • Collaborating closely with executives and key stakeholders to deeply understand business objectives, identify challenges, and design tailored data-driven solutions that align with strategic goals, ensuring measurable impact and value creation.
  • Collaborating with external consulting experts to supplement in-house capabilities and deliver complex projects within tight timelines, particularly in highly specialized domains.
  • Leveraging vendor resources and expertise to supplement in-house capabilities, enhance team productivity, and deliver greater business value.

I have expertise in architecting, developing and improving data and AI systems which includes:
